5 Best Free Video Converters | How To Play On Any Device

2014 / April / Education / Free Stuff / Free Video Converters / Play all video formats / Software / Tips & Tricks / Top 5 xcp_optin_post: gplus_authorship_disabled: 1 socialauthorbio_custom_checkbox_meta: a:1:{s:22:"DisableSocialAuthorBio";s:7:"Disable";}

5 BEST FREE VIDEO CONVERTERS

What good is having a super-compressed MPEG4 video if you can’t watch it on whatever device you choose? Sure, that movie may look absolutely awesome in HD on your computer,  but it can be an absolute nightmare to watch on your home console, or if you choose to go on your tablet or smart phone when going wireless. Luckily, some of the best free video converters have been around for several years, allowing users to convert their precious video footage into any desirable formats. The best attribute of the 5 Best Free Video Converters, is that they are completely free.

Most video converters work in a similar way, requiring the user to upload their files and select an appropriate output setting before choosing a save location within their computer’s directory. However, some fail when it comes to speed or conversion quality, while others pave the way with intuitive features that project you into a realm of enhanced video editing and let’s not forget the fever of social media integration, especially now that SEO has changed leaning more towards credible content-rich websites that will fare better if they properly implemented a solid social media marketing plan.

Without further ado, here are our picks for the best free video converters! Now, please go and free yourself from the ball-and-chain formats of the past and blast into the future by converting video that always playable on practically any device you want to watch a video and escape for a much-needed moment away, and most important, without a glitch!

If this article is up your alley so far, you may also want to take a gander at our popular post detailing Our Top 5 FREE Graphic Editing Software For Web Design. Learn More, Click Here!

5. Any Video Converter (Windows/Mac OS X)

Pros

  • Free to a point
  • User-friendly
  • Handled conversions to everything from DicX and MPEG4 to VOB
  • More than 60 other input formats
  • Minimalist interface that’s trouble-free
  • Easy navigation without being overly daunting
  • Software features user-defined video outputs
  • Batch processing for converting multiple files simultaneously
  • The ability to save all converted video to a pre-designated folder for quick access
  • HTML5 output for web design

Advanced Features

  • Extract and convert audio from any given video into MP3, AAC, and WAVE
  • Download and convert YouTube videos by simply pasting the video link into a field
  • Download and convert Google videos by simply pasting the video link into a field
  • Conversions for mobile devices and consoles, among other machines

Cons

  • Conversion speeds leave something to be desired
  • Built-in DVD burner was finicky at best

Download Link

  • Any Video Converter (AVC) Download

4. Media Coder (Windows/Mac OS X)

Pros

  • Terrific conversion features
  • Boatload of customizable features for converting video
  • Numerous output formats to choose from
  • Batch processing
  • Compress files for a reduced memory footprint
  • Quick conversion and an emphasis on maintaining the original quality across formats
  • Speed and resulting quality are also grade A

Advanced Features

  • Converting video to gray-scale, quarter-pixel, cartoon, or high-quality mode
  • Bit-rate adjustments for both the audio and video components of your file

Cons

  • Geared more towards the tech aficionado opposed to the first-time user
  • Other tools bundled in the software will download to PC without opting out
  • Interface can be bewildering at first glance

Download Link

  • MediaCoder Download

3. Format Factory (Windows/Mac OS X)

Pros

  • Terrific conversion features
  • Boatload of customizable features for converting video
  • Numerous output formats to choose from
  • Batch processing
  • Compress files for a reduced memory footprint
  • Quick conversion and an emphasis on maintaining the original quality across formats
  • Speed and resulting quality are also grade A

Advanced Features

  • Converting video to gray-scale, quarter-pixel, cartoon, or high-quality mode
  • Bit-rate adjustments for both the audio and video components of your file

Cons

  • Geared more towards the tech aficionado opposed to the first-time user
  • Other tools bundled in the software will download to PC without opting out
  • Interface can be bewildering at first glance

Download Link

  • Format Factory Download

2. Cloud Convert (Web Based)

Pros

  • Free-to-use
  • Easily navigable design
  • User Friendly
  • Allows users to select files ranging from FLV and MLV files to 3GP and MPEG4
  • One of the best online tools for simple file downloads and conversion
  • Easily select files from your Google Drive or Dropbox account
  • Drag-and-Drop feature allows video to be dropped directly into the browser window from you desktop
  • The entire conversion process takes place “in the cloud”
  • Automatic emails or the ability to drop the resulting file in your Google Drive or Dropbox account in lieu of saving it to your computer
  • Proficient in converting a range of files without ever deviating from the smooth interface
  • No need to download software
  • No ads

Advanced Features

  • Multiple output settings such as aspect ratio, codec, bit-rate, and resolution which can also be tweaked from the Web app’s sparse interface prior to converting the files

Cons

  • Lacks the and advanced feature set
  • Lacks in speed compared to standalone programs for Windows and Mac OS X

Direct Link (Software Not Needed)

  • Cloud Convert Link

1. Handbrake (Windows/Mac OS X)

Pros

  • Freeware (Completely 100% Absolutely Free)
  • Very expansive software package for ripping and converting video files
  • Playback on number of popular devices such as iPods, AppleTV, and Android tablets.
  • Sleek and well-designed
  • Forums are always available and a good source for help
  • Does NOT feature any ads or bundled malware
  • Can’t be topped when converting files to MP4 or MKV format

Advanced Features

  • Abundance of video editing tools for splicing, adjusting frame-rate, and adding subtitles and assorted video effects before viewing the results in a live preview window.
  • Queue multiple encodes for quicker batch processing and expedited results sans tedious manual input
  • Download and convert Google videos by simply pasting the video link into a field
  • Conversions for mobile devices and consoles, among other machines

Cons

  • Sometimes intimidating to the beginner with the overwhelming number of features
  • The ability to customize features is highly advanced and takes a bit of getting used to before being able to take full advantage of each feature’s capabilities and uses
  • Conversion speeds can drag
  • Heavy on system resources

Download Link

  • Handbrake Download

Honorable mentions

In today’s day and age, everyone has their own criteria for determine which software platform is best for you or your company so that doesn’t mean the top 5 Branches Web Solutions picked are the only capable, free video converters worth checking out if you desire another flavor. Below are just a few of the other standouts amid the myriad of choices for free video converters. Some are light on features, some are more robust, but give ‘em a look nonetheless.

    1. Free Video Converter (Windows)
    2. Total Video Converter (Windows)
    3. Hamster (Windows)
    4. Media Converter (Mac OS X)
    5. Zamzar (Web-based)

What do you think of our selection for the best free video converters? Do you have something else in mind when it comes to great video conversion tools?
